question.title: Why is my Java Spring application taking 5+ minutes to startup?
question.body:
I have a number of Java spring services in my repo. Yesterday, all of a sudden, they started taking 5+ minutes to startup. They pause at Attaching Agents: [] section (see below). They do eventually startup but just after a while.

james@fedora:~/Documents/repos/services/oauth-service$ mvn spring-boot:run
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
[INFO] 
[INFO] ----------------------< com.harlyy:oauth-service >----------------------
[INFO] Building oauth-service 1.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO]   from pom.xml
[INFO] --------------------------------[ jar ]---------------------------------
[INFO] 
[INFO] >>> spring-boot:3.3.10:run (default-cli) > test-compile @ oauth-service >>>
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- checkstyle:3.6.0:check (default) @ oauth-service ---
[INFO] Starting audit...
Audit done.
[INFO] You have 0 Checkstyle violations.
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- resources:3.3.1:resources (default-resources) @ oauth-service ---
[INFO] Copying 7 resources from src/main/resources to target/classes
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- compiler:3.13.0:compile (default-compile) @ oauth-service ---
[INFO] Recompiling the module because of changed source code.
[INFO] Compiling 52 source files with javac [debug parameters target 21] to target/classes
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- resources:3.3.1:testResources (default-testResources) @ oauth-service ---
[INFO] skip non existing resourceDirectory /home/james/Documents/repos/services/oauth-service/src/test/resources
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- compiler:3.13.0:testCompile (default-testCompile) @ oauth-service ---
[INFO] Recompiling the module because of changed dependency.
[INFO] Compiling 8 source files with javac [debug parameters target 21] to target/test-classes
[INFO] 
[INFO] <<< spring-boot:3.3.10:run (default-cli) < test-compile @ oauth-service <<<
[INFO] 
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- spring-boot:3.3.10:run (default-cli) @ oauth-service ---
[INFO] Attaching agents: []

I initially thought it was a network issue and my third-party requests (like to Azure Key Vault) where just taking a while to resolve, but I connected my machine up via Ethernet and the problem still occurred.

I have also restarted by machine multiple times, restarted by IDE and used the terminal window rather than the console. All with no luck.

And finally I tried re-cloning the repository and the issue still occurs, even though in our production containers the application takes <10s to startup.

question_comments.body: To get more info you could enable debug logging for org.springframework.boot.maven to get more output on what the plugin is doing (and where it is halting).
Just wondering if you could be running in to host resolution issues. See stackoverflow.com/questions/33289695/….
Try taking a thread dump while the app appears to be paused. The stack of the main thread should show what it's doing or waiting for that's taking so long.

It is amazon coretto 21, Fedora 41, maven 3.9.6. I was using the terminal to make sure the IDE wasn't doing anything strange. Once I get it working in the terminal I can try out the IDE, although the same behaviour occurs in the IDE
Upgraded Java version? Newer Maven version? Which OS? Also is there a compelling reason to use mvn spring-boot:run instead of just running the application in your IDE?
